001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
004
005import java.util.List;
006
007/**
008 * A loss function implementation that computes the sum of errors
009 * rather than their mean.
010 *
011 * <p>
012 * {@code SummedError} can operate at both the sample level
013 * ({@link SampleLossFunction}) and the batch level
014 * ({@link BatchLossFunction}). Instead of averaging errors,
015 * it aggregates them by summation, producing a larger value as the
016 * number of dimensions or samples increases.
017 * </p>
018 *
019 * <p>
020 * This approach is useful in contexts where the absolute magnitude of
021 * the error across dimensions or samples is important, or where mean
022 * aggregation would dilute the contribution of individual errors.
023 * </p>
024 *
025 * <p>
026 * Typical usage includes situations where cumulative loss across all
027 * outputs or samples is desired, rather than a normalized mean value.
028 */
029@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
030public class SummedError implements SampleLossFunction, BatchLossFunction {
031
032    /**
033     * {@inheritDoc}
034     */
035    @Override
036    public float calculateBatchLoss(List<Float> sampleLosses) {
037        float loss = 0.0f;
038        for (float sampleLoss : sampleLosses) {
039            loss += sampleLoss;
040        }
041        return loss;
042    }
043
044    /**
045     * {@inheritDoc}
046     */
047    @Override
048    public float calculateGradient_dJ_dL(int batchSize) {
049        return 1.0f;
050    }
051
052    /**
053     * {@inheritDoc}
054     */
055    @Override
056    public float calculateSampleLoss(List<Float> dimensionLosses) {
057        float loss = 0.0f;
058        for (float dimensionLoss : dimensionLosses) {
059            loss += dimensionLoss;
060        }
061        return loss;
062    }
063
064    /**
065     * {@inheritDoc}
066     */
067    @Override
068    public float calculateGradient_dL_dl(int dimensions) {
069        return 1.0f;
070    }
071
072}
